column4: hey there. Trying to create a PXEServer to install ubuntu but having some difficulties with dhcp server
trying to run dhcpserver in the host, but the host itself is getting a ip
Where is the DHCP server?
YOu need to trun OFF the dhcp server on your router.
on the same box
well, I need the dhcp server in the router
else I won't  be able to do a net install
The host should have a static IP.  (You can't have two dhcp servers running on the same LAN).
I'm trying to run the dhcp server on eth0 only
So turn off the dhcp server on the router and let the dhcp server on the PC take over.
the router is wireless
can't this be done without removing dhcp form the rourter?
the router is wireless, and I'm trying to use nat with a phisical cable
It will be much easier if you just turn off the dhcp server on the router and let the dhcp server on the PC take over.
the dhcp in the router is over the wireless connection. Over the wired connection is working ok
but for some reason, when I do the wired connection, the computer that's acting as a bridge is losing access to the internet
Are they intergrated?  Or not?
What router do you have?
I'm trying to install ubuntu in a laptop that doesn't have an optical drive and usb boot doesn't work
so I'm trying to use another laptop to act as a pxeserver and use net install
What subnet do you have on the Wireless?  What subnet do you have on the wired network?
wireless: 192.168.1.X; wired, I'm chosing 192.168.0.X
What do you mean, you are choosing?
I'm configuring /etc/dhcpcd for those values and assiging that class to eth1
